segment.source: Use DISM to work with Provisioning Packages (.ppkg) files.
segment.target: Use DISM to work with Provisioning Packages (.ppkg) files.

segment.source: For example, you can add settings and Classic Windows applications to Windows 10, or reduce the size of your Windows installation.
segment.target: For example, you can add settings and Classic Windows applications to Windows 10, or reduce the size of your Windows installation.

segment.source: Use DISM to work with Provisioning Packages (.ppkg) files.
segment.target: Use DISM to work with Provisioning Packages (.ppkg) files.

segment.source: For example, you can add settings and Classic Windows applications to Windows 10, or reduce the size of your Windows installation.
segment.target: For example, you can add settings and Classic Windows applications to Windows 10, or reduce the size of your Windows installation.

segment.source: Adds applicable payload of provisioning package to the specified image.
segment.target: Adds applicable payload of provisioning package to the specified image.

segment.source: Get the information of provisioning package.
segment.target: Get the information of provisioning package.

segment.source: Dehydrates files contained in the custom data image to save space.
segment.target: Dehydrates files contained in the custom data image to save space.

segment.source: For client editions, this package is used by the push-button recovery tools.
segment.target: For client editions, this package is used by the push-button recovery tools.

segment.source: Specifies where the provisioning package is stored.
segment.target: Specifies where the provisioning package is stored.

segment.source: Specifies the drive that contains the Windows image.
segment.target: Specifies the drive that contains the Windows image.

segment.source: DISM scans this drive for any non-system files on this drive and incorporates them into the provisioning package.
segment.target: DISM scans this drive for any non-system files on this drive and incorporates them into the provisioning package.

segment.source: After DISM captures the non-system files to a compressed provisioning package, DISM adds pointers on the drive to the new compressed provisioning package, and removes the original files.
segment.target: After DISM captures the non-system files to a compressed provisioning package, DISM adds pointers on the drive to the new compressed provisioning package, and removes the original files.

segment.source: As a result, the files are still visible to the system, but take up less space on the drive.
segment.target: As a result, the files are still visible to the system, but take up less space on the drive.

segment.source: Applies to: Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education) only.
segment.target: Applies to: Windows 10 for desktop editions (Home, Pro, Enterprise, and Education) only.
